TopicTitle: I just bought Making History but have no idea of what to build

Articles.Content: So I just bought the Making History Expansion Pack but I have no idea of what to build. Now I already built a Soyuz and am currently building the Saturn 5 but other then that what should I build?
Bigger rockets with the 5m fuel tanks.
Ok any ideas of what to build with them though?
Whatever you were doing before you got MH, but moar.
try building Skylab and sally-hut 1 (Salyut 1)! I guess you could make Mir too.

20 hours ago, Singhnaut said:

try building Skylab and sally-hut 1 (Salyut 1)! I guess you could make Mir too.

Makes yourself N1. Or inverse Sat 5

Inverse would be command pod where the F1s were, and Mastadoons where the CMSMLM were
Add Making History parts to your usual builds.
saturn v or SLS or saturn 1B or soyuz!

Yes, I recommend building a smaller rocket or 2 to get started (Vostok, Soyuz, etc.), then build yourself a good Saturn V. To do it right, you really need Modular Launchpads. If you don't feel like building a rocket, I know that it gives you stock craft (Acapello is the Saturn V, for example)

Also, just build your own original, non-human rockets with the new parts.

Get insane! Think like a kerbal! Make a 5 meter rocket, then radially attach 4 or 6 more 5 meter tanks on it! Burn up on exiting the atmosphere, not entering! \Go crazy! The only limit is your imagination! (and how good your computer is, otherwise you will experience          lag.

IMHO, one of the best features from Making History is the Mission Editor.

And one of the best Missions built with it is this one - you may want to try it once you get a grasp on the new parts:
Hello making history the ideas here are really MAKING HISTORY.  I wanna have more discussion about this.

There are times, in my unmodded game, I have a desire to make Kerbalized replicas of concept craft from the "golden age" of spaceflight (1950s through the 1970s). Here's a website that sells plastic model kits that are of concept craft of both the United States and Soviet Union, but the images are a good start for inspiration.

It's really possible to get really close to the designs in the pics. Anyhow, hope this gives you some inspiration.

https://fantastic-plastic.com/1950s_concept_spacecraft.htm
